chargeHist.descr: Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal)

result.execSummary:
The defendant Donvonta R Pearson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: Sentence credit of 5 days were granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Cash bail applied to costs, paid in full. Balance refunded to poster.
Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.

Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license. Attend a Criminal Thinking course. Maintain employment and/or school combination.Obtain a GED/HSED. Provide DNA Specimen unless previously obtained. Surcharge is imposed. 
  If probation is revoked and a prison term is not ordered, or if probation is discharged/terminated, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collection may include income assignment.

timeConds.notes: Non-working hours. Release for standard conditions. Commencing 06/20/16 by 5pm. May be served in Milwaukee County.

supervisions.notes: Defendant IS Eligible for Challenge Incarceration and Substance Abuse Programs. Sentence credit of 220 Days were granted.

superMiscConds.notes: Costs previously imposed have been paid.

No Violent Contact with Ms Cotton. Maintain employment and/or school combination. Engage in any treatment or counseling deemed necessary by the agent. 
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donvonta R Pearson in court, in custody, with attorney Kelsey Loshaw.   Andrea M Will appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  State makes statements.  Defense makes statements.    The Defendant was sentenced to the following:

COUNT 1 - SENTENCING AFTER REVOCATION

3 YEARS IMPRISONMENT (CREDIT - 220 days)
  -  1 YEAR OF INITIAL CONFINEMENT
  -  2 YEARS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION;

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:  
*Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling 
*No violent contact with:  Ms. Cotton
*Engage in treatment or counseling deemed necessary by the agent.

COURT COSTS:  $268.00 (to be converted to a Civil Judgment if they are not already paid);
DNA SURCHARGE:  $250.00 (to be converted to a Civil Judgment if they are not already paid);

Defendant is eligible for Challenge Incarceration Program.
Defendant is eligible for Substance Abuse Program.

Felony warnings, voting rights and firearms warnings given.
appointing Kelsey Loshaw 9/7/17
Transcript received and filed for the following date and event: from June 6, 2017 Sentencing
filed, to be produced from Milwaukee House of Corrections for a Sentencing After Revocation.
Sentencing hearing on revocation on October 3, 2017 at 02:30 pm.

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Donvonta R Pearson in court with Attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Case called for sentencing hearing.  State gives sentencing recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements regarding sentencing.  Court sentences the Defendant to the following:

COUNT #1:  WITHHELD SENTENCE

TERM OF PROBATION:  18 MONTHS  (5 days credit, if revoked)   *transfer allowed to Milwaukee County* 

CONDITIONS OF PROBATON:  
____Maintain employment and/or combination of schooling - obtain GED/HSED
____Not to operate a motor vehicle without a valid driver's license 
____Criminal Thinking Course
____DNA sample to be provided if not yet previously done

COSTS:  $268.00 & $250.00 DNA surcharge  (to be paid out of cash bail posted and remainder to be returned to posted)

CONDITION TIME:  30 days, Non-working hours with standard release conditions to commence 6/20/16 by 5:00 p.m. - may be served in Milwaukee County.

Felony Warnings, Voting Rights and Firearms Warnings provided to defendant
 
 ** Expunction is conditionally granted upon verification of completion of sentence, payment of all costs/fees and no new criminal law violations.**
Sentencing hearing on June 6, 2016 at 02:45 pm.
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.
